ygData.subject: Teleporters
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually (sorry for the delay on responding to this), you can adjust the way the teleporters work by setting their character level -- if I recall correctly

From: Tom Ricket <tricket@...>

Actually (sorry for the delay on responding to this), you can adjust the way
the teleporters work by setting their character level -- if I recall
correctly (without looking at the code), all teleporters of a given level
will cycle together .. so a set of 3 Level 5 teleporters will form a
"triangle" of teleporters, while you can also have (say) a set of two Level
10 teleporters that will bounce back and forth to each other.

--Tom

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel Paul Hightower [mailto:dph_of_rules@...]
Sent: Monday, August 06, 2001 2:33 PM
To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Various pieces of info (WAS: Re: [gladiator] Re: Small bug in
my version of the scenario converter.)


> Regardless yes it can be sorted.  I don't think the game cares much 
about
> where objects are in the list, or if there can be speed gains from 
sorting
> them a specific way (Tom?) so it should be ok.

The game does care.  It dishes your team out on the grid according to 
the order in which the player positions are listed in the file.  With 
teleporters, it goes to the 1st teleporter laid down, 2nd teleporter 
laid down, etc for a given teleporter number until it gets to the last 
one.

Having the scenario converter around is almost as good as having a 
full-blown scenario text editor.
